sentences.en: A is the nominal output of the auxiliary signal.
sentences.cn: A是附加信号的额定输出.

sentences.en: A nominal charge is made for use of the tennis courts.
sentences.cn: 使用这些网球场只是象征性地收取费用。

sentences.en: All nominal outputs of the shift register are 1.
sentences.cn: 移位寄存器的全部“原”输出都为1.

sentences.en: All the ferries carry bicycles free or for a nominal charge.
sentences.cn: 所有的渡船都免费或以极低的收费运载自行车。

sentences.en: Food is supplied at a nominal cost.
Guy was elected leader and then found to have the highest EQ on a nominal measure.
sentences.cn: 盖伊当选领导，在后来一次定类测量中发现他的情商是最高的。

sentences.en: I am prepared to sell my shares at a nominal price.
sentences.cn: 我做好了以极低价格卖掉自己股份的准备。

sentences.en: I was brought up a nominal Christian.
sentences.cn: 我成长为名不副实的基督徒。

sentences.en: In 1990 personal incomes grew a nominal 6.8 per cent.
Inflation would be lower and so nominal rates would be rather more attractive in real terms.
sentences.cn: 通货膨胀会更低，因此名义利率换算成实际利率会更具吸引力。

sentences.en: Nominal diameter is the diameter of a sphere of the same volume as the given particle.
sentences.cn: “等容粒径”是某一球体直径,它与某已知的颗粒体积相等.

sentences.en: The charge of the box lunch was nominal.
The managing director has the nominal power but he is a paper tiger, and it is his assistant who actually runs the company.
sentences.cn: 总经理名义上有权,可他却是一只纸老虎, 实际管理公司的是他的助手.

sentences.en: The nominal diameter has little significance in sediment transportation.
sentences.cn: 等容粒径在沉沙输移中意义不大.

sentences.en: the nominal head of the rebellion
sentences.cn: 这次叛乱名义上的领导人

sentences.en: The old man is only the nominal head of the business.
sentences.cn: 那老人只是这个企业的挂名的总裁.

sentences.en: The settler got the house at a nominal price.
sentences.cn: 移居者象征性地花点钱买下了这栋房子.

sentences.en: Their conversion to Christianity was only nominal.
sentences.cn: 他们只是名义上皈依了基督教。

words.tran_cn: 名义上的；有名无实的；[会计]票面上的

phrases.tran_cn: 公称尺寸；毛尺寸；标称尺寸

trans.tran_cn: 名义上的，微不足道的，票面上的，名字的，列名的
trans.tran_en: officially described as being something, when this is not really true
